body.name: QuTZ Toddler Toys for 2 3 4 5 Year Old Boys and Girls, Autism Sensory Toys for Autistic Children, Learning Montessori Toys, Speech Therapy Toys, 224 Sight Words Talking Flash Cards

features: [ Toddler Learning Toys ] - This speech therapy toy includes a card reader and 112 double sided flash cards covering 12 subjects like shapes, colors, animals, daily necessities, transports, food, fruits, vegetables, costumes, nature, persons & jobs. Great learning toy for 2 year olds and up to learn sight words, enhance cognitive ability, exercise hearing and build vocabulary. Great autism sensory toys for autistic children.

[ Easy to Use ] - Put the card into the card reader’s slot, the card reader will pronounce the words. When an animal card or transport card is inserted the card reader will play real animal or transport’s sound. Press the repeat button to repeat the pronunciation and sound effect. This montessori toy keeps kids away from mobile phone and tablets, reduce screen time effectively.

[Rechargeable & Light ] - The toddler toy comes with built-in rechargeable battery and can be used for up to 4.5 hours, no need to charge frequently. The card reader weights 71g and dimension is 4*3.5*0.5inches, easy for kids to hold. Volume is adjustable. A portable bag is provided for easy storage of the cards and card reader

[ Appliable Both for Home & Class ] - This toddler toys can be used by parents and teachers to teach little ones learning talking, expand vocabulary and reinforce sight words in a much more interesting way, especially helpful for autistic kids to develop speech capability.
[ Great Gift ] - This learning toy is a great gift for birthday, Christmas and other holidays for girls and boys ages 2 3 4 5 6 years old. Play it with kids together to have some great family time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a great learning resource!
reviews.reviewText: These talking flash cards for toddlers are a game-changer! The interactive element engages my child in a fun and educational way. The clear and lively audio prompts make learning exciting, and the vibrant visuals capture my toddler's attention effortlessly. The durability of the cards is commendable, withstanding the inevitable wear and tear of toddler play. This set has become an invaluable tool in promoting early learning and language development. I wholeheartedly give it 5 stars for its educational value and entertaining approach to learning!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing tool to build language skills
reviews.reviewText: As a mother of a 2-year-old with mild speech delay, I've had the pleasure of trying out this product, and I must say it has been a wonderful addition to our learning and playtime routine. First and foremost, the variety of learning content in this set is impressive. It covers a wide range of themes, including alphabet, numbers, shapes, colors, and flags. It's fantastic to have so much educational material in one place. Additionally, they've made a smart move by removing uncommon objects, making it more suitable for preschool learners.This versatility ensures that it will grow with your child as their learning needs evolve.What I appreciate most is how easy it is for my toddler to use. You simply place the card into the card reader's slot, and it will pronounce the words, which is an excellent way to engage their budding language skills. Inserting animal or transport cards produces real sounds, adding an interactive and immersive element to the learning process. The repeat button is a great feature as well, allowing my child to practice pronunciation and sound effects. This is particularly helpful for reducing screen time and keeping my child away from mobile phones and tablets, which is a constant concern in our family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kids you never know
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for 4 year old niece. She is pretty smart and learning to read. She got the biggest kick out of device saying insert a card. She played with it some, but I think I liked it more than she did. I still recommend this as it is great for learning. I think it is something an adult can play with a child turning it into a game while they learn. It was great value for the money. Kids are unpredictable the old "they played with the box" not the toy can happen at any time, she liked it as much as any other toy. I noticed that the kids don't play with anything very long except their tablets. She will sit and watch videos on her tablet for hours. Other toys are a few minutes and on to the next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The device itself is amazing, but the cards are paper and very flimsy making it easy to destroy with little hands. Make sure you keep an eye on your little one if they are little gremlins that like to destroy paper!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Neat toy for kearning
reviews.reviewText: These are pretty amazing learning items. Purchased 2 for a 1 year old and a 2 year old. Lots of flash cards, front and back. Cards are easy to bend, so they do need assistance. Hope there are more cards to add. Easy to take to stores or restaurants to keep them occupied.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good idea needs work
reviews.reviewText: Product is good. Only main issue is that the cards feel cheap and easily bent. Cards are very thin and can be easily bent. It would be better if they would be laminated or at least make them a bit thicker so they don’t bent as fast and easily

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a really fun product for the kids and can work on many developmental goals like color identification, reading, speech, etc. in the package that I purchased, they put the word “wine” in there. I feel like that’s not the most appropriate word to put in a kids toy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My toddler loved it, the sound is amazing, super helpful, can’t wait to see him learned them all!
